Posts.Content: Wanted to thank this website for all the good information I have read here. The knowledge I have gained here has removed a lot of the fear about my prostate cancer diagnosis & surgery. Recovery in progress...
Posts.Signature: Very first PSA at my "over 50" physical (Aprox age was 51)= 4.07 Each one after adveraged around 3 to 4. At age 54: 12 Needle biopsy - May 2013. Only 2 out of the 12 samples taken showed cancer. Only 20% of those 2 samples had cancer cells. Robotic Radical Prostatectomy - October 2013. Dr said surgery went "text book perfect". Cancer was fully contained in the prostate, did not spread to any other organs, etc. Nerve sparing good all the way around. Catheter out at 2 weeks. (Pee'd on my foot, note to self remove shoes next time.) 6 Week PSA = <0.01 Back to work at 6 weeks as maintenance electrician in factory. Currently at 12 weeks out. No erections yet. Still have incontinence issues. Mostly dry at night. Using Jock Strap & male guards, maybe 2 or 3 in 24 hour period.
Posts.Title: 55 year old newbie wants to thank you all!

Posts.Content: Prostate Cancer not back. PSA's still great. Will be three years since removal this coming October. But still kicking me in butt. Tried to increase my life insurance policy & make decisions about my pension application. Looking forward to higher premiums, if I get accepted. Crap!
